statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Khris Lane scored a career-high 24 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead Longwood to an 87-74 victory over Division II Salem International and its first win of the season on Friday night.
article.headline: Longwood gets 1st win of the season, beats Salem Int. 87-74
article.linkText: Longwood gets 1st win of the season, beats Salem Int. 87-74
article.story: FARMVILLE, Va. -- Khris Lane scored a career-high 24 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead Longwood to an 87-74 victory over Division II Salem International and its first win of the season on Friday night. Darrion Allen was 4 of 8 from long range for 16 points and Isaiah Walton added 14 points, dished out seven assists and had three steals for Longwood (1-2). The Lancers, who jumped out to a 30-6 lead midway in the first half, were up 45-36 at the break. They stretched that to 64-49 with 10:09 remaining. Salem International pulled to 82-70 in the final minute but could not catch the Lancers. Saquan Epps was 6 of 8 from the floor for 18 points for Salem International. Jarius Farrow scored 17 points on 7-of-11 shooting, and Victor Blakey chipped in 14 points.
